checklist.title: Is the pre-order system UI properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code accurately implements the product categorization UI (Pork Products, Beef Products, Fish, Vegetables) with clear visual hierarchy and proper labeling. Score 0 if categories are not implemented, 5 if basic categories exist but without visual distinction, and 10 if categories are clearly styled with proper headers and section separators.

checklist.title: Is the product listing functionality complete?
checklist.description: Review whether all 37 products across the 4 categories (23 pork items, 6 beef items, 7 fish items, 7 vegetable items) are correctly implemented with proper naming and categorization. Deduct 2 points for each missing or incorrectly categorized product. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the discount logic properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of the tiered discount system (¥4 off over ¥50, ¥10 off over ¥100, ¥22 off over ¥200). Check for correct mathematical calculations, proper threshold detection, and whether discounts are automatically applied to eligible orders. Deduct 3 points if discounts are not applied automatically, 4 points if the calculation logic is incorrect, and 3 points if discount thresholds are not properly detected. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the shopping cart functionality comprehensive?
checklist.description: Check whether the shopping cart includes essential functions like adding/removing items, quantity adjustment, real-time price calculation, and subtotal display. The system should maintain item counts accurately and apply discounts correctly. Deduct 3 points if quantity management is missing, 3 points if real-time calculation is absent, and 4 points if the cart doesn't persist during the session. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as out-of-bounds input, network interruption, user operation errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time stock availability indicator 2. Seasonal product highlighting 3. Personalized recommendations based on cart items). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple discount calculation methods) 2. Function modules unrelated to pre-ordering (e.g., a built-in game while waiting) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations on product listings). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating product data/UI/calculation logic), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast scrolling through product lists, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
